title: Release log
content:
The Service Management release log is a cumulative list of features introduced in each release. This log helps you with a quick review of all the new features that were added for each release version.

25.4

Aviator updates

Aviator Agents 

  • Administrators can create Aviator Agents and define a task plan (with serial or parallel tasks) that the agent will perform when called. 
  • An Aviator Agent Record enables the execution of all standard manual and automatic tasks, including calls to Aviator and Orchestration flows, as well as Integration Studio. 
  • Administrators can use the Standard Studio Business rule process to initiate a call to an Aviator Agent and create an Aviator Agent Session record.
  • The Agent Session record includes the full audit history of all the actions taken by the Aviator Agent. 

Service Management updates

Customer Service Management

  • Service and Support requests and Live Support have been extended to work with Products and Entitlements. This feature enables a Service and Support request to work with Products and Entitlements, allowing visibility in the Service Catalog. For details, see Create a request record.
  • A new feature has been introduced to enable SLA for case requests. This feature enables the time tracking of SLA calculations for case requests. For details, see Create Service Level Target Set record and Create Service Level Agreement record.
  • CSM Module security has been enhanced by applying CSM Entitlement logic to right-side navigation content
  •  The system-defined lists CompanyTypeEnum and RequestCreationSource are now unlocked. This allows administrators to add or edit list items and modify the lists as needed. See the Lists page for information on working with lists.

Studio updates

  • Task workflow and Record Category workflow have been unlocked to allow greater configuration.
  • Record Category field in Studio is unlocked to allow new fields to be added.
  • Manual Task and Automatic Task processes are now unlocked and can be edited. Phases and transitions are now editable, and new phases can be added. The existing end phases cannot be removed. New phases added to the Done metaphase are treated the same as the Completed phase. No changes have been made to Approval Task Process or External Task Process.

Platform updates

  • Filtering improvements 

  • Exact Match filtering option has been added for small text fields. The text entered must match exactly, allowing users to precisely control which records are included in the filter.
  • Multi-select filtering for text fields extends text filtering to allow users to filter by multiple text values within a single filter. Pasting a list of values into the filter from another source is also supported for greater efficiency. 

  • New tenant setting has been added to enable or disable the availability of the switch to JATO UX option. For details, see Application settings.

Native SACM

  • Native SACM now supports Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • The ‘Guided modeling only’ permission has been added. This is only available when a user has 'Service modeling' permission. A user with 'Service modeling' and 'Guided modeling only' permission can use the service modeling feature only while using modeling templates. For details on roles and permissions or guided modeling, see Roles and CI topology.
  • The enhanced topology map visualisation of CIs from the UCMDB UI has been adopted. For details, see CI topology.

Integration Studio

  • ZENworks Integration:  

  • Enhanced Digital User Experience with natively integrated OpenText ZENworks Endpoint Management and SMAX via Integration Studio connector and template for ZENworks. For details, see Integration Studio - ZENworks.

  • Support for application/octet-stream protocol to handle attachments:

  • Integration Studio has been enhanced to support the application/octet-stream protocol, which allows transfer of attachments with products like Azure DevOps and OpenText Octane. For details, see Azure DevOps integration and ALM Octane integration.

  • New DSL to generate QR code: 

  • Now with built-in QR code generation capability, SMAX makes it easier than ever to connect people, processes, and information. From service requests and asset details to knowledge articles and event check-ins, you can instantly create QR codes that simplify access and enhance user experience. For details, see gen_qr_code in DSL functions.

  • Enhanced security measures by making Personal Access Token (PAT) expiration mandatory: 

  • The No expiration checkbox has been removed (hidden) from: 

  • Integration Studio – Generate Listener popup. For details, see Listener.

  • Self Service Portal – User Profile PAT page. For details, see Use OData for BI integration.

  • Customers cannot generate a new PAT without an expiry date. Existing PATs without an expiry date can continue.

    Mobile updates

    • Updated cookies consent banner to reflect recent changes in app usage and privacy preferences. 

    See the mobile app documents for details.

      Asset Management 

      Analysis section

      • Product lifecycle analysis page has been updated, showing additional widgets for software versions with upcoming and past end of life and obsolete dates.
      • EOS product analysis section has been renamed to Product lifecycle analysis.
      • Detailed lists of software titles in product lifecycle analysis have been updated to match updated widgets.

      Licenses section

      • Refined the layout of New license page to logically allow entry of quantities and rights before showing (calculated) entitlements
      • Refined layout of License detail page to logically show quantities and rights before (calculated) entitlements, and moved all items above to Overview section

      Products section

      • When Universal Discovery is using Raynet Technology Catalog as a source of software normalization and enrichment, SAM will use General Availability dates to automatically create an upgrade or downgrade License compatibility matrix.

      Terminology updates

      • SAM pages and widgets in Compliance, License, Analysis, and Product sections have been updated to provide a consistent, industry-standard terminology (entitlements, (use) rights, and licenses (purchased quantity)).
      • Product lifecycle terminology has been updated to better align with industry standards and UCMDB. Please see the following table for the updated terms.
      Before 25.4From 25.4
      EOSEOL
      End of supportEnd of life
      Extended EOS dateObsolete date
      Extended end of support dateObsolete date
      End of support (EOS) product analysisProduct lifecycle analysis
      Release dateGeneral availability date
      End of support dateEnd of life date
      EOS product analysisProduct lifecycle analysis

      Automation Center

      Operations Orchestration Containerized

      Improved queue cleanup mechanism

      A new mechanism has been introduced to enhance the cleanup process of the engine queue, contributing to improved orchestration reliability and consistency. Updates to the management of execution states and queues support more streamlined and resilient operations.

      Cloud Management 

      • Multiple OPB endpoints support in JavaScript - Cloud Management design and deploy module now accepts two or more on-premises bridge endpoints as part of the JavaScript used for fetching the values from a remote source. The same data can be fetched from the alive and ready endpoint when other endpoints are unavailable. 
      • The Classic mode of FinOps is now obsolete, and users will only be able to use the OP Mode. The classic mode of FinOps capability enablement is now removed from BO. 

      Support matrix updates

      Added support

      • PostgreSQL 17.x

      • React library 19.x 

      • Mobile: Android 16, iOS 26

      K8s support changes

      • EKS: 1.32, 1.33
      • AKS: 1.32, 1.33
      • GCP: 1.32, 1.33
      • OpenShift: 4.17, 4.18, 4.19

      OO Containerized support changes

      • Upgraded Apache Tomcat to 10.1.44 

      • Upgraded Java to 17.0.16-17.60.17 

      • Upgraded Python 3.12.11.0 

      • Added PostgreSQL 17.x and removed PostgreSQL 13.x

      • Upgraded Bootstrap to 5.3.7 

      • HTTP Client upgraded to 5.4.4 

      • Upgraded Spring Boot to 3.4.7  

      • Upgraded React library to 18.3.1 

      • Added support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10 and Rocky 10 for remote presence components (OO Workflow Designer and External RAS)

      25.3

      Dev2Prod support for Models

      Allows Models (Change, Incident, Release) to be built on a development tenant and then migrated into production, reducing the risk of errors being introduced to the production environment.

      Integration Studio enhancements

      • Support custom rule execution status: The custom rule condition allows users to define logic that evaluates the execution status of a rule. It determines whether the rule should be marked as passed (true) or failed, based on the content of the API response. For details, see Custom status rule expression in Understand scenario rules.
      • Observability for Integration Studio:  Monitor integration service using open-source tools supported as part of Smart Monitoring and Analytics capability (SMA), we've built a Grafana dashboard that captures real-time metrics for:
        • Scenario and Rule Execution
        • Online and Offline status of Scenarios and Rules
        • Across the Farm Level and each Tenant Level
      For details, see Integration Studio Metrics in Monitoring with open source tools.
      • Microsoft 365 Integration:  
        • Support the direct attachments in the emails for create and update scenarios
        • Support the direct attachments in the email for the update scenario
      For details, see Create records from emails and Update records by emails in Integration Studio—Microsoft 365 email integration.

      Mobile application updates

      This release includes several important bug fixes to enhance the user experience.

      Additionally, License information has been added under the Third Party Licenses option on both Android and iOS mobile apps. Click the Third Party Licenses in the Settings menu to view the License file.

      See the mobile app documents for details.

      Native SACM enhancements

      The navigation from Devices, Actual Services, Service Components, and System Elements to their corresponding Configuration Items in UCMDB has been improved. Now, the Explore button will open a new tab containing the UCMDB CI Explorer Properties widget, which allows you to view the main, general properties of the CI.

      Platform enhancements

      • ENUM list changes: The maximum number of items per record has been changed to 28.
      • Agent Chat: The window has been resized to improve usability across various screen sizes.

      Software Asset Management updates

      • Software Asset Management is enhanced with scheduler functionality to support bulk updates. Users can now select multiple products to configure schedulers simultaneously. When a single product is selected, its existing scheduler settings are displayed. For multiple selections, the scheduler initializes with default values, eliminating the tedious task of scheduling items individually and ensuring a better user experience.
      • Compliance report details grids in the SAM Home dashboard and compliance tabs in Software Asset Management have been enhanced to support the column picker utility, ensuring a better user experience. 

      Support matrix update

      K8s support update

      • EKS: 1.31, 1.32
      • AKS: 1.31, 1.32
      • GCP: 1.30, 1.31, 1.32
      • OpenShift: 4.16, 4.17, 4.18

      OO Containerized support changes 

      • Upgraded Apache Tomcat to 10.1.42
      • Upgraded Python to 3.12.10

      25.2

      ITOM Aviator Updates 

      The Aviator chat window is now context-aware and available in most applications, expanding beyond Request and Incident to enhance user interaction across the platform.

      Service Management enhancements

      Native SACM enhancements

      Configurable CI Type Mapping now empowers the configuration to extend SACM federation on additional UCMDB CI types after the system upgrade or Native SACM activation. During migration, it dynamically determines the minimal set of federated CI types, and offers maximum flexibility for customers to decide when and how to federate UCMDB CI types to unlock additional use cases. For more information, see CI type, attribute, and subtype federation.

      Customer Service Management (controlled availability)

      Customer Service Management extends Service Management to support entire external organizations, rather than just individual users. This expansion also provides account managers and support agent with the visibility and context needed to effectively manage external organizations and their users. CSM introduces a new Request type, Case Request, with its own process flow. A corresponding offering type, Case Offering, has been implemented to assist with creation of Case Requests

      Software Asset Management updates

      • Compliance scope extension: add support for individual product compliance across different scopes, e.g. license types. With this capability, organizations can customize compliance checks and processes to meet the specific requirements of each scope, ensuring proper management based on its terms and conditions. See Create compliance reports based on product compliance scopes.
      • Software Asset Management is extended to freeware software, ensuring better tracking and governance.
      • A new property License class is introduced to differentiate between purchased licenses and sold licenses. Purchased licenses represent the licenses managed under the Software Asset Management process. Sold licenses follow a different workflow, to manage licenses sold to customers. Sold licenses will be fully functional with the upcoming Customer Service Management functionality. 
      • SAM's SaaS management solution has been expanded to support more SaaS products – Wrike. We have provided a scenario template for this product to simplify the SaaS product management experience. See Integrate with Wrike for SAM.

      Enterprise Asset Management updates 

      • If an enterprise asset is linked to a Change or Problem record on its Involved CIs tab, the enterprise asset's Related records tab now displays the Change or Problem record.
      • Batch receiving in the stockroom and the SACM Home page is now supported for consumables, streamlining inventory management.
      • License receiving is now integrated into the software asset management lifecycle, enabling more informed procurement and renewal decisions. For more information, see the documentation about Receiving assets and the License workflow.

      Automation Center enhancements

      • Remediation Job Management is introduced to enable intelligent management of remediation jobs. It allows more flexibility in the planning, tracking, and executing remediation tasks efficiently, with logic that can accommodate an organization's business and technical requirements and constraints.
      • Vulnerability Management enhancement: support Tenable integration for seamless correlation of vulnerabilities with CIs and available patches, enabling automatic prioritization and targeted remediation.

      Integration Studio enhancements 

      • Listener now supports both synchronous and asynchronous modes, providing greater flexibility for handling inbound integrations, such as MS Teams, WhatsApp and OBM integration efficiently. See Send responses with payload data to the external system in scenario rules.
      • Synchronous call capability is now supported by Integration Studio, laying the foundation for future real-time data processing and seamless external system interactions. See Add and configure scenarios.
      • OAuth2 authentication is now available for SAP SuccessFactors. See SAP SuccessFactors OAuth 2.0.
      • Extended token expiration time for inbound email: maximum token validity is now extended to 90 days. See Specify email validity time frame.

      Platform enhancements

      • Rule improvement: When defining filters in Suggested Values for Entity Link or M2M relationship rules, you can now use Entity Link properties to refine value selection. For more information, see Field selection rule examples.
      • Filtering enhancement: When setting a filter on person fields in reports or grids, you can now select the current logged-in user’s name, in addition to the dynamic ‘Me’ option. For more information, see Filter by field value.
      • FinOps reports rendering improvement: The display of time series line and area charts has been refined for improved clarity.
      • Entity link fields on Form: To protect query performance, a limit has been introduced - a maximum of 50 entity link fields are allowed in a form through the Form Designer or grid column view. If this limit is exceeded, a validation warning message will be displayed. For more information, see Edit a form.
      • Rich text editor update: A new rich-text editor is available in the Service Portal and Agent user interfaces, offering a smoother and more intuitive text formatting experience. The previous editor will be deprecated, so we recommend switching through an application setting at your earliest convenience. See Enable new rich-text editor.
      • OAuth2 authentication enhancement of API: The system now allows you to use access tokens generated by any external Identity provider to authenticate against the SMAX APIs. By using this OAUTH2 based authentication method the usage of Personal Access Tokens (PATs) from external applications calling the SMAX API is no longer required.

      New REST APIs

      • Dev2Prod APIs are now available, enabling customers to automate the Dev2Prod process based on a predefined schedule tailored to their needs. These APIs streamline deployments and reduce manual effort, particularly for frequent Dev2Prod executions. For more information about how to use these APIs, see Dev2Prod - Synchronize your development and production tenants.
      • More APIs (such as EMS REST API, Authentication API, Encryption domain API) are now accessible through the API documentation portal, which follows OpenAPI standards for easier consumption and streamlined development experience.

      New User Experience (JATO UX) 

      • A new user experience, JATO UX, is now available on select UI components (such as login page, menu navigation, dashboard, Aviator chat window, support for a dark mode/light mode) for agent users to review for a future usage consideration. JATO UX delivers a UX consistency across OpenText products and improves overall usability. You can try it out for future usage via a switch under your user profile.
      • This UX is still evolving, and broader coverage is planned for future releases. 
      See Agent user interface.

      Support matrix update

      K8s support update

      This release newly supports the following versions:

      • EKS: 1.31, 1.32
      • AKS: 1.31
      • GCP: 1.31
      • OpenShift: 4.16, 4.17

      OO Containerized support changes

      • Added support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.4
      • Upgraded Spring Framework to 6.2
      • Upgraded Spring Boot to 3.4
      • Upgraded Apache Tomcat to 10.1.36
      • Upgraded Python to 3.12.9

      25.1

      This release introduces the following new features or enhancements.

      ITOM Aviator updates

      • Aviator chat window: This is now available in the Request and Incident grid besides the detail record. 
      • Multilingual accuracy improvement: A new setting for the language used in Aviator conversation, either auto-detected or a specified company-wide language. See Aviator language.

      Integration Studio enhancements

      The Integration Studio now provides improved framework, new connectors and refined contents to enable customers with more seamless integrations. 

      Framework Improvements 

      • This new release adds common actions like End Scenario, Search capability to find actions, integrations and scenarios. For more information, see Common actions.
      • Improved Integration Studio framework will now allow customization of headers for integrations with third party applications.
      • Improvements in Execution History where users can now delete all execution history in one click, traverse using Last/First page button to easily move to first page or last page. For more information, see Execution History.
      • New DSL Functions added are - match, base64_decode,base64_encode, double_to_int. For more information, see DSL functions.

      Inbound Email Integration

      • Microsoft 365 Integration: Introduced a new scenario template that updates records via email. Users can add comments, accept or reject solutions, and approve or deny tasks by replying to emails. For more information, see Integration Studio—Microsoft 365 email integration.
      • Gmail Integration: A net new Gmail connector that works with OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code to integrate with Gmail. This connector includes actions to read and update messages, download mail attachments, and download entire emails as attachments. For more information, see Integration Studio - Gmail integration.

      Downtime propagation for event suppression in OBM

      • Scheduled Downtime Forwarding: Customer can now suppress events during maintenance windows by forwarding scheduled downtime set on Service Management change requests to OBM. For more information, see Schedule downtime.

      User and Group Data Integration

      • SCIM Connector: Introduced a SCIM connector to sync user and group data with products that support the SCIM standard. This connector includes actions to list, create, replace, delete, update, and perform bulk operations on resources like users and groups. For more information, see SCIM Connector.
      • Azure AD: Users can now import changed users and groups by using Microsoft Graph delta API. For more information, see Integration Studio—Microsoft Azure Active Directory (AD) integration.

      Reporting enhancements

      • Service Management Reporting: Multiple functions of the same type (average, count, sum, percent by count, percent by sum) for chart display. For more details, see Reporting.

      SLM process enhancements  

      • Service Level Requirements: A new sub-menu Service Level Requirements is available to show the initialized agreements which are in the New phase. For more information, see Work with Service Level Requirements.
      • Support Model for Agreements: Users can create a new service level requirement based on a Model with default values or approvals. For more information, see Create an agreement model.

      Software Asset Management updates 

      • SAM's SaaS management solution has been expanded to support more SaaS products – Zoom and Atlassian Jira. We have provided scenario templates for these products to simplify the SaaS product management experience. See the "Integration Studio enhancements" section above for the names of the scenario templates.  

      Cloud Management updates 

      • The IT Operations team can deploy playbooks as a Cloud Management offering by integrating with the Ansible Automation platform (enterprise edition) and Core (community edition) using out-of-the-box integration with Cloud Management. The Ansible playbooks can deploy software on top of the VM instance deployed by the Terraform plan through Cloud Management integration.  

      Mobile updates 

      • Microsoft Intune support for Android: A new Android Mobile app is released to allow customers to manage and configure the Service Management mobile app with Microsoft Intune to deliver enhanced security and streamlined management of Android devices. You can now configure the domains allowed to log in to the Intune-managed mobile application for Android and iOS.
      • OneTrust cookie compliance for Android: Ensure effective privacy management for the Service Management mobile app and adherence to global regulations.  

      See the mobile app documents.

      New API documentation in OpenAPI format 

      • The new API doc in OpenAPI format is now available on the API Documentation Portal, providing a standardized and developer-friendly resource for seamless integration. The product name should be Service Management.
      • More APIs will be continuously added to the portal, building a comprehensive and powerful platform to support developers in creating innovative solutions. 

      Miscellaneous enhancements

      • User management: Allow non-admin users to manage person records in Agent interface. See Users and contacts.
      • Native SACM: Updates done in UCMDB or Service Management will be shown in the CI history with the name of user that did the update.   

      Support matrix updates 

      • Added support 

        • GCP deployment for Automation Center 

        • Mobile: iOS 18 

        • Vertica 24.1.x and 24.3.x in Enterprise Mode

      • K8s support 
        This release supports the following versions: 

        • GKE: 1.30 

        • OpenShift: 4.16 

      Helm transformation 

      Classic upgrades are no longer supported. If you are still on a classic deployment, you must upgrade to 24.4 and then perform Helm transformation before you can upgrade to this release. 

      Service Management Content packs released on Marketplace

      Supporting resources for this release are available to download for free from the ITOM Marketplace:

      • SMA Cloud Deployment Package 
      • SMA Support Assistant
      • SMA Doctor
      • SMA Monitor
      • PostgreSQL Instance Monitor

      Cloud Management capsules and content packs

      Supporting capsules and content packs for this release are available to download for free from the ITOM Marketplace. 

      24.4

      This release introduces the following new features or enhancements.

      New HR Service Management  

      Expanded HR Service Management support featuring: 

      • Best practice HR Service & Support data package catalog: Expanded with six new top-level categories, 18 new Service Definitions, and 58 new offerings. See Out-of-the-box content for HR Service Management.  

      • Expanded best practice HR Reporting Dashboard (4 new reports)

      • Aviator-enabled privacy analysis. See Configure Aviator.  

      • Request fulfillment with SAP Success Factors integration: 

        • New Catalog Offering and Integration Scenarios to provide Employee Record information through the Portal and Aviator. See Integration Studio—SAP SuccessFactors integration.

        • Expanded New Employee Bundle integrated with the SAP Success Factors onboarding process. See HR SM use case: New hire onboarding with the onboarding bundle. 

      • HR process automation using powerful platform capabilities 

        • New Employee Bundle provisioning combining HR, IT, Facilities, and Security request fulfillment. See HR SM use case: New hire onboarding with the onboarding bundle.  

        • Sample HR Support Offerings with approval and fulfillment workflows. See Out-of-the-box content for HR Service Management.   

      ITOM Aviator updates

      • Built with Llama: Aviator now utilizes the LIama3.1 model, which has been fine-tuned on our IT Operations product documentation, enhancing its ability to understand and respond to user queries with greater precision and speed. 

      • Extended multilingual support: Added support for four new languages: Greek, Swedish, Chinese, and Norwegian. See Language support.

      • Global search capability: Aviator now combines the inbuilt keyword search of our Aviator service with the Service Management semantic search capability allowing Aviator to generate comprehensive and valuable answers based on any Service Management artifact or record. See Aviator models.

      • AI-Enriched workflow with search: An additional Aviator business rule is available that includes the ability to perform a search against any Service Management artifact to be included in the response from Aviator. See Action rule examples.

      • Out-of-the-box AI enriched workflows by Aviator: to help with enabling AI within your workflows and processes, a number of AI enriched workflows have been included for you to use or modify to fit your business needs 

        • Sentiment Analysis and Escalation Notification for Request process 

        • Risk Analysis for Change process 

        • Suggest Solution for Incident process and Knowledge Creation from incident candidates 

        See Configure Aviator.

      • Virtual Agent Evolution: Virtual Agent on Service Portal now utilizes Aviator model, offering improved configurability and functionality. See Aviator models.

        Agent experience improvements 

      • Consolidated inbox: A unified view by aggregating records from multiple types is offered to agent users, which helps them streamline their daily work with improved focus and a better user experience.  See Get started with Inbox.

      • Task management improvements 

        • Task Plan Lockdown: Task plans can now be locked to prevent agent users from making on-the-fly updates, ensuring stronger process governance. See Control access to task plans.

        • Refined Out-of-the-Box Task Views: Out-of-the-Box task views have been improved by removing hard-coded filters, allowing agent users to gain a holistic view of tasks based on their roles. 

      • Enhanced 'Contains' search experience: Now supports ‘contains’ search in the Entity Link editor with fewer than 3 characters for Japanese, Korean, and Chinese (Simplified). See Enable the "Contains" search for entity pickers and text filters.

      • AVIF image file support: Added support for the AVIF file format as attachment or in rich text field. See Default values in a tenant.

      • New tenant setting for CI detection: Introduces a new setting to enable or disable the CI detection function. See Enable CI detection. 

      Service Portal improvements 

      • Configurable 'Mark as Solved' button in Support Request: Customer can now hide the "Mark as Solved" action in Service Portal support request from Feature settings. This allows for customization of the default actions available to end users for managing their support requests. 

      • Copy Request: The function is now available on the request details page, which allows users to quickly create requests based on an existing request. This is designed to enhance user experience by simplifying the process of duplicating and managing requests, ultimately saving time and increasing productivity for Service Portal users. See Copy a request.

      • Accessibility improvements: This release brings new accessibility improvements to Service Portal. The UI elements and interactive items are enhanced, making interactive and navigation elements easily accessible by assistive technologies. See Accessibility improvements. 

      • Popup Message: You can now configure a popup message box for a custom action in Service Portal configuration settings. 

      • Theme setting improvements: The Category text background color and Category text background blur settings are newly introduced in theme settings to give you more customized options. See Service Portal display theme settings.

      Mobile updates

      • Microsoft Intune support for iOS: a new iOS Mobile app is released to allow customers to manage and configure the Service Management mobile app with Microsoft Intune to deliver enhanced security and streamlined management of iOS devices. 

      • OneTrust cookie compliance for iOS: Ensure effective privacy management and adherence to global regulations. 

      See the mobile app documents.

      Studio and platform enhancements 

      Application Studio 

      • Entity Link dropdown configurability: Provides extra information to the selection process to help differentiate between similar records by enabling the addition of extra properties in the dropdown list of Entity Links. See UI components.

      • Record-Level Access Control: This new capability provides granular control over which records are visible to agent users based on their direct or group based association with the record. Which fields are used to control the VIEW permission access is configured in Studio. See Record level access control.

      •  New business rule templates: Makes Studio configuration quicker and easier to maintain. Adds new rule templates to apply a single rule across multiple fields, including (see Rendering rule examples and Validation rule examples):   

        • Define fields as mandatory or read-only 

        • Disable fields 

        • Hide actions / fields / sections / tabs 

      • New Suggestion rule for Many2Many: Introduces a new rendering rule to define suggested values for Many2Many fields based on filters, achieving function parity with Entity Link fields.  See Define suggested values for relationship based on filter.

      • DSL enhancement: Adds a new to_upper_case() function to improve data manipulation. See Expression Language functions and syntax.

      Integration Studio 

      • Inbound email integration with Microsoft 365: Supports record creation with attachments using Microsoft Graph API and OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code. Based on the powerful Integration Studio, strong authentication and flexible customization will enhance the inbound email solution for customers without the need for On-Premises Bridge (OPB) or Connect IT. See Integration Studio—Microsoft 365 email integration.

      • Enhanced UCMDB Connector: Supports bulk operations for creating, updating, and deleting CIs from UCMDB. See Connectors.

      • Service Management to Service Management case exchange: Existing case exchange template will now include support for rich-text comments and inline images. See Case exchange.

      • New Studio function: Introduces a new “Sleep” action to pause scenarios after calling asynchronous APIs. See Built-in actions. 

      • Extended ECM integration: Adds an embedded widget of Extended ECM in the Related Documents tab of a record for improved document management based on the integration with OpenText Extended ECM. See Integrate with Extended ECM.

      IT Service Management 

      • SLM workflow enhancements: Unlock and extend the Agreement workflow including Approval support; add a few out-of-the-box fields for Agreement to capture service level requirements and review details for the agreement.  

      • Guided modeling: Offers a new Guided Modeling function within the embedded service modeling widget to make the modeling work much easier based on modeling templates. See Guided modeling. 

      • "Vendor" menu entry has been renamed to "Company" to more properly align with, and reflect that it can contain many different companies types, not just vendors. See Company management, Create company record, and Company workflow.

      Software Asset Management

      • Compliance reports for organizations: Software asset manager can generate compliance reports based on organization scopes defined by location, cost center, or custom criteria. This will ensure that an organization adheres to software licensing laws and regulations, thereby reducing the risk of legal penalties and audits. By assessing current software usage, the report also helps in optimizing license allocation, preventing both under-licensing and over-licensing.  See Organization compliance scope and best practice Create compliance reports based on organization scopes where provides a Location-based use case.

      • Content: Supports compliance report for Oracle database licensing in hard-partitioned environments such as IBM LPAR virtualization technology.  See best practice Create compliance reports for Oracle LMS-managed products.

      Enterprise Asset Management   

      • Enterprise Assets receiving and reservation: Now asset management agents can receive Enterprise Assets through Procurement Management, SACM Home, or Stockroom Management. See How to receive assets in Service Asset and Configuration Management. They can also reserve Enterprise Assets from either  SACM Home or the Reservation tab of request. This streamlines the request to fulfillment process for Enterprise Assets, to ensure that Enterprise Asset requests are managed effectively and that the requested assets are delivered to the appropriate users or departments. See Create a manual reservation. 

      • Batch management for consumables: The batch option has been introduced into both Asset Models and Enterprise Asset records. By using this feature, assets can be managed collectively rather than individually. Batch management also supports bulk receiving, allowing for the creation of a single asset record to optimize inventory management. See Create an asset model record and Create an enterprise asset.

      Cloud Management
